邊.definition: suffix of a noun of locality

邊兒.definition: side; edge; margin; border; boundary; proximity; thread (of ideas, plots etc); see also 邊|边[bian1]

邊幅.definition: fringes of cloth; (fig.) one's dress; one's appearance

邊幣.definition: Border Region currency, issued by the Communist Border Region governments during the War against Japan and the War of Liberation

邊廂.definition: side; side-room; room in the wings

邊患.definition: foreign invasion; disaster on border due to incursion

邊控.definition: border control (abbr. for 邊境控制|边境控制[bian1 jing4 kong4 zhi4]); to place sb on a border control list (a list of people to be detained if they attempt to enter or leave the country)

邊材.definition: sapwood (between vascular cambium and pith inside growing wood)

邊民.definition: people living on the frontiers; inhabitants of a border area

邊沁.definition: Jeremy Bentham (1748-1832), English philosopher, jurist, and social reformer

邊疆.definition: border area; borderland; frontier; frontier region

邊緣.definition: edge; fringe; verge; brink; periphery; marginal; borderline

邊緣人.definition: marginalized people (not part of mainstream society); marginal man (term coined by social psychologist Kurt Lewin, referring to a person in transition between two cultures or social groups, not fully belonging to either)

邊緣性人格障礙.pinyin: biān yuán xìng rén gé zhàng ài

邊聲.definition: outlandish sounds (wind blowing on frontier, wild horses neighing etc)

邊角料.definition: scrap; bits and pieces left over

邊角科.definition: leftover bits and pieces (of industrial, material)

邊路.definition: sidewalk; side road; shoulder (of a road); wing (soccer)

邊遠.definition: far from the center; remote; outlying

邊釁.definition: clash on the frontier; border conflict

邊關.definition: border station; strategic defensive position on frontier

邊頭.definition: the end; border; just before the end
